model_answer: Answer: A: It exemplifies “traveling too fast,” turning RV life into a vacation-like sprint rather than a sustainable lifestyle.

Option A: Because setup/breakdown requires physical tasks (picking up hoses, climbing steps, even going on the roof), reinforced by a shot of a man actively washing the RV with a hose.
The audio mentions that health and mobility are common reasons why people quit full-time RV living. The shot of a man actively washing the RV with a hose illustrates the physical demands associated with setting up and breaking down a RV, which can be challenging for individuals with limited health or mobility.
